intro: Neuwiedia griffithii, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at elevations between 2,000 and 4,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, velvety hair, while its stems are erect and often branched. Neuwiedia griffithii is a perennial herb that blooms in late summer, contributing to the alpine flora's biodiversity.
